Dekra is a world-leading company in the field of safety and risk management and advanced dispersion, explosion, and fire modelling.
Dekra provides a wide range of risk and safety studies, including HAZID, HAZOP, LOPA, Dangerous Substances and Explosive Atmospheres Regulations (DSEAR/ATEX), FLACS-CFD, as well as other 2D tools, such as FLACS-EFFECTS, FLACS-RISKCURVES, Shell FRED and Shell Shepherd.
We also offer accident investigation, fire and explosion testing, R&D and experimental testing, and software sales and support.

Principle Process Safety Engineer
The Principal Engineer is considered a very senior appointment. This person has the task of not only leading a small team but also acting as the major interface when new business winning opportunities arise. The teams you will manage are a mixture of Senior / Project and graduate engineers. Dekra is very focused on Continuous Process Development – CPD – this is important to the team and you will be part of the senior team driving these maxims across the team you manage and set up the required metrics for your team. A measure of your success will be theirs! CPD for yourself is also important and you will have ample opportunity to establish yourself as a key industry mover and shaker. We expect you by right to represent Dekra at all the leading forums. As the main interface between clients and the consultants you will drive the bid process and scope out new projects in accordance with the Dekra bid methodologies.
Your seniority to the team is such that we are very comfortable with you working remotely.
Dekra has an agile working policy and has adopted a flexible attitude where possible to the requirements of the business and geographic location of employees to our customers.
Other factors are also taken into consideration such as seniority.
The “new” normal is not always ideal for people – so if this is an issue then working close to the UK Hub may be the ideal option.

Applications and CV's must be presented in English
Applicants must already have UK right to work
Duties and responsibilities
As a Senior Process Safety Engineer, you will work within a multidisciplinary team and will be supported by a very experienced coordinated UK and Global consultancy team that will continuously support you to develop your skills. You will have the following main tasks:
Contributing to and managing projects within relevant areas
Conducting risk assessments and identifying the required preventive and protective measures
Conducting hazardous area classification studies for gas, vapour and dust (DSEAR / ATEX)
Providing guidance and issuing pragmatic recommendations to eliminate and mitigate the risk of explosions and fires
Modelling the frequency and development of accidents
Modelling the consequence of accidents HAZID/ HAZOP workshops
Answering technical safety issues
Help develop and maintain Dekra’s commercial relationships with clients
Responsible for generating leads, opportunities, and projects for the consulting department (especially for senior engineers)
Qualifications
Masters (or Bachelor’s with significant experience), in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Maths (STEM) with preference for Chemical Engineering Process Safety and Loss Prevention, Risk Management, Fire & Explosion Protection Engineering or similar degree
Preferably 5-10 years for senior engineer roles, 3 - 5 years for project engineer roles and experience in technical consultancy with knowledge of a broad range of safety and risk subject areas, including ATEX / DSEAR compliance
Experience, displaying enthusiasm for areas of expertise and providing motivation, guidance, and support to colleagues and the wider technical community
COMAH / SEVESO experience is a plus but not necessary
CFD experience is a plus but not necessary
Commercial project management
Full UK Driving Licence
Personal qualities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Fluent in English (writing and speaking), As Dekra is a multinational organisation, ability to communicate in other languages is always a plus
Must be detail-oriented, highly organized, and a self-starter
High levels of initiative and ability to work under critical time deadlines and prioritize while exercising discretion, diplomacy, and good judgment
Ability to take ownership of projects and multi-task
Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to maintain effective working relationships
Ability to interact with consultants and staff at all levels as well as with clients and business contacts
Ability to work as part of a multi-disciplined team and willing to be cross-trained
Ability to perform physical site visits (including at times, climbing ladders etc.)
We can offer
Competitive conditions and career progression, including attractive salary, generous pension scheme, healthcare and other employment benefits
Opportunity to receive training for software and other safety courses
Active encouragement and support to those who wish to continue with further education and personal development
A positive working environment to help provide a healthy work-life balance
